titulo_oferta: Business Analyst - Private Equity & Principal Investors
descripcion: Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in our Madrid office as part of our Private Equity & Principal Investors (PEPI) practice. Our practice is the worldâ€™s leading advisor to the PEPI industry and a high growth area for the firm, working with many of the most significant global and local private investors and their portfolio companies.You will work in teams and directly with our clients. You will also work with the wider McKinsey network including a range of experts in the firm, from industry and functional experts to data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and youâ€™ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who will manage staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams. When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.What You'll DoYou will work in teams to support private investor clients and their portfolio companies throughout the deal lifecycle including diligence, value creation topics and exit support.In this role, you will have the opportunity to assess and identify market attractiveness, provide targeted information and specialized financial analysis on potential acquisitions as well as prepare and deliver high-impact communication of your synthesized findings. You will also have the opportunity to work directly with portfolio companies on their value creation agenda, spanning a diverse set of topics as well as be a subject matter expert on topics related to our service to investors. You will be recognized as a valuable resource of experience, information and expertise both inside the firm and by our clients.You will receive training on how to better structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them as well as synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative method. You will work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act. You will establish trust-based relationships with clients to better-serve their organizations, communicate effectively with all audiences including senior leaders and develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths and personal values.During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a business analyst on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of private investor settings across different industry and functional areas and develop significant business experience as well as an investor mindset. You will likely intersect with many elements of our firmâ€™s work including digital, implementation, and tech and analytics capabilities.Your role differs from McKinseyâ€™s generalist business analyst role in its focus. Your role will focus entirely on serving investor clients and their portfolio companies (though because our clients invest across sectors and types of companies, the role still offers exposure to a wide variety of sectors and functional levers). PEPI consultants will be staffed full time to client engagements.QualificationsUndergraduate degree or masterâ€™s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degreePrevious experience in investment bank, private equity or venture capital environment with exposure to transactions and/or working in a private equity or venture capital backed company is a plus Investor mindset and experience or strong interest in private equity, real estate and/or venture capitalAbility to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organizationCapability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team projectComfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situationsAbility to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysisAbility to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in Spanish and English

Strong experience with cloud technology (AWS or Azure) Strong experience with the creation of data ingestion pipelines and ET processes. Strong knowledge of big data tools such as Spark, Databricks and Python Basic understanding of common machine learning techniquesFamiliarity with Natural language processing (NPL) concepts. Strong knowledge of scrum practices and agile mindsetSkills & Core CompetenciesStrong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills with attention to data quality and accuracyClear Communication of technical concepts and effective collaboration across teamsAdaptability to New Technologies and a proactive approach to learning and growthTeam-oriented mindset, working closely with data scientists, AI engineers, and cross-functional teamsOpenness to Feedback and collective problem-solving for continuous improvementTeam player, willing to improve yourself Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social, and inclusive culture.Like all businesses, weâ€™ve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. About UsAt Auctane, we are united by a passion to help sellers â€” wherever they are, however they operate â€” fulfill the promises they make to consumers. The Auctane mission is to fuel commerce through exceptional delivery. We make it possible for businesses to meet the ever rising expectations of their customers, and we make the world smaller and more accessible to consumers everywhere. Auctane brands enable hundreds of thousands of merchants to annually deliver billions of products â€” over $200 billion worth â€” to customers around the globe. And Auctane is just getting started.Auctane is a team of shipping and software experts with a passion for helping merchants move their ideas, dreams and innovations around the globe. The Auctane family includes ShipStation, Stamps.com, ShipEngine, Endicia, Metapack, GlobalPost, Packlink, and Return Rabbit. Our partners include Amazon, UPS, USPS, eBay, BigCommerce, Shopify, WooCommerce, and Walmart.Our valuesWin as One. Delight Customers. Deliver Great Outcomes.About The RoleAre you obsessed with data, sales, taking action, and changing the game? If you have a whole lot of hustle and are ready to make an impact, come work with Auctane and use your skills to push one of the largest eCommerce companies in the world to further excellence!The Sales Analyst will work on the Global Revenue Operations team and is responsible for enabling the worldwide revenue team with actionable data and intelligence through the creation of data models and data analysis. descripcion: About UsAt Auctane, we are united by a passion to help sellers â€” wherever they are, however they operate â€” fulfill the promises they make to consumers. The Auctane mission is to fuel commerce through exceptional delivery. We make it possible for businesses to meet the ever rising expectations of their customers, and we make the world smaller and more accessible to consumers everywhere. Auctane brands enable hundreds of thousands of merchants to annually deliver billions of products â€” over $200 billion worth â€” to customers around the globe. And Auctane is just getting started.Auctane is a team of shipping and software experts with a passion for helping merchants move their ideas, dreams and innovations around the globe. The Auctane family includes ShipStation, Stamps.com, ShipEngine, Endicia, Metapack, GlobalPost, Packlink, and Return Rabbit. Our partners include Amazon, UPS, USPS, eBay, BigCommerce, Shopify, WooCommerce, and Walmart.Our valuesWin as One. Delight Customers. Deliver Great Outcomes.About The RoleAre you obsessed with data, sales, taking action, and changing the game? If you have a whole lot of hustle and are ready to make an impact, come work with Auctane and use your skills to push one of the largest eCommerce companies in the world to further excellence!The Sales Analyst will work on the Global Revenue Operations team and is responsible for enabling the worldwide revenue team with actionable data and intelligence through the creation of data models and data analysis. These responsibilities are delivered through close relationships with BI team and Revenue leadership, definition & refinement of the key sales data, merchants attributes and behaviors, as well as measuring the performance of the campaigns against established targets, and recommending actions to drive improved revenue performance.What will you be doing?Day in the Life: Utilize advanced SQL, DBT, Looker and skill sets to analyze data sets as set forth by the Revenue Leadership team. These may include (but are not limited to):Retail Sales dataForecastingMerchants attributes and behaviorsIndustry dataTransform data into actionable insights specifically designed to address the needs of the Revenue organizationIdentify high-potential accounts/customers/prospects through data analysis and automate ICP identification through predictive and prescriptive modelingCreate sales data campaign queries and work with BI and our Salesforce teams to get the next best opportunity in front of our sellersPush to learn and become a subject matter expert on our carrier, software, insurance, and other offeringsSeek to understand areas for data efficiencies and push forward innovative and game-changing projectsThis person will be responsible for creating actionable customer and prospect intelligence for our sales teams, producing automated sales campaigns, identifying through data models the next best opportunity, reporting on sales performance (revenue/expense/customer trends), modeling impact of investment, and performing root cause analysis.What are we looking for?Required Education and/or Experience: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years' experience. Three or more (3+) years of relevant work experience.Two or more (2+) years' experience in relational database concepts with expert knowledge of SQLTwo or more (2+) years of experience modeling investment opportunity or financial planningOne or more (1+) years of experience managing and developing business intelligence solutions, such as Tableau, Looker, or Sisense for Cloud Data Teams (preferably Looker)Experience in a fast-paced, global environmentStrong track record of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworksExperience with building reports and dashboards in SalesforceSkills and Knowledge:Business acumen is required - understanding the levers to pull to produce growth and associated risksSQL, BigQuery and DBT experienceStrong PowerPoint and Microsoft Excel skills are requiredUnderstands descriptive and prescriptive statisticsStrategic Bias - weighing scale vs. expediency, and can identify opportunities and risks within existing systems.Ability to clearly and concisely communicate results and insights to management and directorsAble to effectively combine quantitative data and qualitative information to communicate the "so what" of a situation to drive actionable insightsPassion for customers and interest in eCommerceAbility to work cross-functionally to understand and deliver on business needsData management skills (cleaning, linking, analyzing, reporting)Able to balance fun & positive working relationships with the need to have direct conversations around business performanceSalesforce reporting experienceWhat will make you stand out?Experience with data analysis in SQL, presentation of dataExperience working with an income statement or knowledge about revenue and business driversExperience with presenting data in a BI tool (preferably Looker)Experience with modeling the financial impact of strategic initiatives, including sensitivity analysisExperience with generalized linear modeling or clusteringThe TechLookerSQLBigQueryDBTPython is a plusMicrosoft ExcelGoogle DocsSalesforceWhat do we offer? ğŸ’¸ Clear and transparent compensation plan. About LumenLumen connects the world. We are igniting business growth by connecting people, data and applications â€“ quickly, securely, and effortlessly. People power progress.Lumenâ€™s commitment to workplace inclusion and employee support shines bright. Weâ€™ve made the Newsweek 2024 Greatest Workplaces for Diversity list and achieved a perfect score of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index (CEI) for the fifth consecutive year. Plus, weâ€™re the top employer in the communications and telecom industry, ranking 12th overall across all industries in The American Opportunity Index.Weâ€™re looking for top-tier talent and offer the flexibility you need to thrive and deliver lasting impact. Join us as we digitally connect the world and shape the future.The RoleWe are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Cloud Network Services Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in HyperScaler cloud environments, with software engineering skills, as well as intermediate knowledge of networking specific knowledge with authentication and internet protocols such as TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS and Radius.The Main ResponsibilitiesParticipate in meetings and conferences to gather requirements and discuss architectural decisions. Company DescriptionNexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.Job DescriptionWe seek a highly skilled and experienced Software and DevOps Engineer for our Engineering team. You will design, build and deliver large-scale resilient and scalable distributed services that process billions of events by using modern cloud-native features and techniques. Your expertise will also contribute to the reliability and efficiency of our platforms, influencing both our product and engineering DevOps practices in ensuring high system availability, scalability, and performance.Please note that this role is hybrid (2 days per week in the office)Responsibilities:Work with Architecture, Product Engineering and Security teams to design, develop and evolve the Nexthink software products, following modern cloud-native best practicesDevelop and maintain tools and automation systems for deployment, monitoring, alerting, and incident response to reduce manual interventions and improve the efficiency of our operations. Collaborate closely with software engineering teams to understand product requirements and provide technical guidance for infrastructure design and and support scalable, durable, and reliable services. Participate in incident handling, investigating, and resolving production incidents to minimize impact and ensure system stability. Lead incident response and post-mortem analysis to prevent future outages and improve response strategies. Perform capacity planning and optimization to ensure the platform meets performance and scalability targets. Conduct regular system and performance analysis, identify improvement areas and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and stability. Troubleshoot and resolve complex system issues, including performance bottlenecks, network connectivity problems, and infrastructure failures. Implement and maintain security best practices throughout the platform, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Advocate for DevOps best practices across the organization and contribute to setting service level objectives (SLOs) and service level indicators (SLIs). Mentor junior team members and contribute to team growth and skill development. Participate in on-call rotations to provide support for the production environment, responding to and resolving incidents promptly. Qualifications8+ years of relevant work experience as a Software and DevOps Engineer, or similar role, developing software, implementing operational processes and tools within cloud application environments. Expertise in core Java (8+) and experience with scripting languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell)Strong knowledge of system architecture and networking concepts, specifically designing scalable and fault-tolerant systems. Very good knowledge of Automated Build Systems (e.g., Jenkins, ArgoCD) for building and managing CI/CD pipelines. Proven experience in "Everything as code": infrastructure (e.g., Terraform, CrossPlane, Packer) and configuration management (e.g., Ansible). Scripting is second nature. Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP). Solid understanding of Linux-based systems, including administration, troubleshooting, and performance tuning. Knowledge of monitoring and logging frameworks (e.g., Prometheus, ELK Stack) and experience with implementing observability practices. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and provide effective solutions. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams. Proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in Lisbon or Madrid and will be part of McKinsey Digital.As part of this group, youâ€™ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. Youâ€™ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.Youâ€™ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world â€“ in private, public, and social sectors â€“ solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers.If you are interested in joining a specific practice, please indicate this in your office/practice preference (combinations are possible). To learn more about how we help our clients and where you fit in, visit our careers site.What You'll DoYouâ€™ll work in teams of typically 3â€“5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement.This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. Youâ€™ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.Youâ€™ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts (BA) receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years as a BA. Additionally, youâ€™ll receive guidance and support from your local office in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.We view the BA position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a BA on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas. We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a 2 year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist BA.Following your BA tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some BAs will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firmâ€™s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.QualificationsUndergraduate or masters degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degreeDegree in computer science, telecommunications, or other engineering/technical related field preferred Demonstrated aptitude for analyticsProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activitiesExceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentAbility to work effectively with people at all levels in an organizationAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively â€“ both verbally and in writing â€“ in English and Spanish/Portuguese Willingness to travel

Job functionProvide financial support to a country or group of countries while reporting directly to the Regional Commercial Finance Manager.The main responsibility will be to support profitable growth within the region and be a strong Finance voice while interacting with sales teams of countries in scope. titulo_oferta: Graduate/Associate Software Engineer - Build & Release Infrastructure
descripcion: Drive the future of collaborative open-source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open-source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.Launchpad is a platform for managing open-source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open-source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). Candidates will be expected to be located within this region.Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply, and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.#stack

Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?This position can be office-based or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK. At Personio, your work transforms the way millions of people experience work every day. Join our Product & Technology team that drives our customer's outcomes by designing, developing and delivering innovative and high quality products. Be empowered to take ownership of your areas and make an impact on your team, our product, and our customers.Join our Security Team that protects our customer's data. Designing, developing and delivering innovative and high security controls and technology. Be empowered to take ownership of your areas and make an impact on your team, our product, and our internal customers.Security is a first class priority in Personio, and we are looking for an experienced Security Engineer to join our Product & Engineering organization on the mission to implement best in class security controls and automation practices. Personio processes highly sensitive data for thousands of customers, and security is a cornerstone of all processes, empowering us to build a fortified foundation for our customer success. Our Security Team is expanding to serve the needs of our customers and our internal engineering teams. You will partner with the engineering teams in a hands-on fashion to ensure that Personio platforms are designed and built securely by building security or advising on it.ResponsibilitiesIdentify risks on the scope of Cloud Security and propose scalable solutions for itInterface with our Site Reliability Engineering team to ensure we get the most security impact while complementing the SREs goals to deliver a scalable on-demand infrastructure by being the subject matter expert (SME) in securityImplement security control that prevents misconfigurations of cloud resources, security observability of best practices about cloud infrastructureUpdate and improve Cloud Security Standards by working with the SRE team, detecting drift between standards and provisioned infrastructure in productionParticipate in security operations, responding to security incidents and providing security expertise for Personio customers and internal stakeholdersKeep yourself up to date about the cloud native technologies that Personio uses and how it overall impacts securityProvide guidance inside the Security team on the golden path for provisioning infrastructureRole Requirements: What you need to succeedBS in Computer Science, Information Security, System administration or equivalent professional experience.Good understanding of security fundamentals (CIA triad) and computer networks (OSI model, TLS). Experience with Cloud Security tooling like CSPM, CNAPP, WAF is a plus.Proven track record of experience with AWS and security related services like WAF, Guardduty, Cloudtrail, IAM. Experience with other CSPs are a plus.Experience with shipping infrastructure changes with baseline quality on tests, scalability and security.Experience with container orchestration: Kubernetes.Demonstrated capacity to work with CI/CD pipelines.Experience with any paradigm of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) like Terraform, Cloudformation, AWS CDK. Any development or scripting experience is a plus.Excellent English written and verbal communication skills and the ability to adapt messaging to executive, technical, and non-technical audiences.Ability to drive and support technical, security and architectural infrastructure reviews. Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.

About Tinybird:At Tinybird, we help developers and data teams take flight by unlocking the power of real-time data to quickly build data pipelines and innovative data products. With Tinybird, you can effortlessly ingest multiple data sources at scale, query and shape it using the 100% pure SQL you already know and love, and publish results as low-latency, high-concurrency APIs for your applications to chirp about. Developers can create fast APIs, fasterâ€”what used to take hours and days now only takes minutes! Tinybird is the essential tool that data engineers and software developers have been waiting for enabling you to drive innovation with ease.With Tinybird, you can capture data from many sources, define SQL-based real-time transformations, and publish your pipelines as low-latency, high-concurrency APIs for your applications to consume. Developers choose Tinybird to ship user-facing analytics features from day 1, not day 90. We're looking for a great full-stack dev and an even greater content creator to be the public face of Tinybird. As our top Developer Advocate, you'll educate and inspire the next wave of great SaaS builders to create incredible things with data.What you will be doing:Create exceptional written and video content to showcase demos and examples you and others have built. Expect to be publishing multiple blog posts and videos every weekBuild demos, examples, and templates using Tinybird as a part of a modern web app stackWork alongside our Product Engineering and Growth Engineering team to produce content that explains and showcases new Tinybird features, integrations, and partnershipsWork with developer advocates from other devtools companies like Vercel, Resend, Clerk, Supabase, and more to produce joint content and integrated examplesPlan and run virtual and in-person trainings and workshops to help developers learn best practices for building things with dataConnect with and support Tinybird users in the Tinybird Slack Community, via email, and through meetups, conferences, and virtual eventsEngage our target communities by being active on social media and in community Discords, Slacks, and other forums where devs congregate. You should want to build and maintain a personal "brand" - people should know who you are on the social channels you're invested inWhat we are looking for:You are an exceptional content creator. You're not only capable of producing studio-quality videos (given the time and tools) and engaging written content, but you also love doing it. You should be able to produce videos like this and blog posts like thisYou are a community engager and want to build your public brand. You have a social media following and regularly post, engage, and reply on Twitter, LinkedIn, Reddit, Bluesky, etcYou are proficient with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/Typescript, Next.js, React, Vercel deployments, serverless functions, git, and other skills expected of a modern web developerYou have some pretty good backend skills. You can hack Python scripts and create basic server-side applications using Node.js or similarYou have some experience working with data and databases. You know the difference between OLTP and OLAP and you're pretty good with SQL. Experience with ClickHouse is a big plusYou work with pace and independence. titulo_oferta: Change Management, SWE SAP PIRT project
descripcion: OverviewAre you interested in a career in Strategy & Transformation in PepsiCo?Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: join us as our Change Management, SAP program South West EuropeYour mission:The Change Management role for SAP Program supports the organizational readiness activities of the deployment of the ERP related transformation in South West Europe.The primary responsibility is implementing change management plans that maximize stakeholder adoption and usage while minimizing resistance. This role will work with Change Management Lead and the project team, with focus on Value Stream Leads, Business Process Owners and project team, interfacing with different levels of management and staff, to ensure adoption, utilization and proficiency of the methodology, processes and tools related to change management, as well as a strong focus on internal communications, to increase benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of business objectives.Job location:This role can be based in any of our SWE headquarters in the following locations: Barcelona, Madrid, Vitoria, Lisbon or Milan.ResponsibilitiesYour day to day with us:Work with Change Management Lead to define the Organizational Change Management governance model, processes and tools for the SAP rollout in South West EuropeAct as Change Management Point of Contact for designated Value Streams and enabling teams, partnering on all OCM activities managing proactive relationships, supporting and coaching teams on the OCM agenda, facilitating the identification and management of change impacts and support teams to develop action plans together with impacted Business Units; ensure theoretical change management approaches are translated into practical and simple plans and visible for all relevant owners/stakeholdersRoll out the process of capturing, reviewing, validating and contributing to program list of change impacts, document change impacts in the change impacts tracker, and build change action plans for market transition success (e.g Change Management workshops to validate and align on change impacts captured in sprints and determine Change Management actions needed for adoption). Ensures that all Change Impacts are implemented as agreed as part of UAT and business cutover activities.Work with Change Management team to execute internal communication plan to maximize engagement across all the different entities and marketsReview Change Impacts Assessment and confirm impacts have been integrated into training materials to be deployedSupport the development of the change management plan alongside Change Management Lead to ensure realistic and deliverable, as well as sustainable post go live in each marketAssist Change Management Lead and Program Management Office (PMO) in creation of materials for key stakeholder events, activities and training plan designQualificationsWhat will you need to succeed?Experience of partnering and/or executing organisational change in technology implementation projects and/or across markets, and experience in designing and rolling out a Communication strategyAbility to facilitate focus group discussions, conduct classroom learning sessions, seminars and workshopsStrong facilitation and coaching skills supporting complex and diverse teams, with different levels within the organizationStrong communication, engagement and influencing skillsExperience of working in multi-functional and multi-cultural teams, and ability to work collaboratively and build strong working relationships with diverse employee groups and stakeholdersEffective multi-tasker with strong time management skills, an ability to adapt quickly to changing environments and balance a varied workloadEnglish language proficiency, Spanish / Italian / Portuguese fluency highly valuedDon't worry if your experience isn't a perfect match - if you're excited about the role, we'd love to hear from you!

Would you like to be part of the future of European navigation systems? If you said YES, then GMV is the place for you! We are expanding our Ground segment team to be part of new navigation projects. Support validation campaigns. Planning and coordination of satellite operations: Participate in planning and coordination activities. Provide inputs to planning and feedback to the execution of activities, including support to critical activities. Operations execution and support: Monitor and control ground and flight segments in LEOP phase, a critical phase of a satellite mission. Operate in console and on-call positions. Support ground segment users in the preparation and execution of operations activities. Monitor operations performance and perform corrective actions. Manage incidents and anomalies, including report writing, processing and support review meetings, to meet KPIs Interface with external entities for data exchange and service outages. Provide 24/7 on-call support. Collect data and report KPI status. Prepare, support and execute integration and verification tasks Prepare, support and execute integration and verification procedures, both at system and segment level.WHAT DO WE NEED IN OUR TEAM?We are looking for experts with experience in satellite operation. Availability, if required, to work shifts and provide on-call support. Fluent in English.Software knowledge: programming (bash or python scripts, ...), operating systems (mainly linux), incident management (JIRA), testing tools (e.g. Robotframework, qTest, Test Link, Test Rail).WHAT DO WE OFFER?ğŸ•‘ Hybrid working model and 8 weeks per year of teleworking outside your usual geographical area.ğŸ’» Flexible start and finish times, and intensive working hours Fridays and in summer.ğŸš€ Personalized career plan development, training and language learning support.ğŸŒ National and international mobility. Do you come from another country? We can offer you a relocation package.ğŸ’° Competitive compensation with ongoing reviews, flexible compensation and discount on brands.ğŸ’ªWellbeing program: Health, dental and accident insurance; free fruit and coffee, physical, mental and financialhealth training, and much more!âš ï¸ In our recruitment processes you will always have telephone and personal contact, face-to-face or online, with our talent acquisition team. In addition, bank transfers and bank cards will never be requested. If you are contacted through any other process, please write to our team at privacy@gmv.comâ¤ï¸We promote equal opportunities in recruitment, and we are committed to inclusion and diversity.WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? Job Description / CapsuleThe Senior Data Analyst will direct the preparation of data-driven insights for business decision makers to help develop business intelligence, optimize effectiveness and/or predict business outcomes. The role will drive the analysis of data to support the process they are enabling through the identification, analysis and interpretation of trends or patterns and prepare ongoing reports and data visualizations to aid in complex data storytelling. The role may coordinate the creation, maintenance and/or improvement of exploratory and predictive analytics statistical models for ongoing and ad hoc review and analysis of data. The role will work autonomously with limited direct supervision from senior team members. Will provide coaching, task management and support to Data Analyst promoting best practice across multiple domains, and/orstakeholder groups.Typical Accountabilities Implementation of Analytical Solutions: Coordinate the implementation of analytical and data visualization solutions to interrogate datasets for insights within project scope. Solutions may utilize tools like Python, PowerBI, and cloud- based platforms. These solutions may also involve exploratory and predictive analytics models.Design prototypes and build functional designs for reporting and visualization.Hands-on use of PowerBI for developing dashboards and prototypes Project Management Perspective on Data and Analytics: Apply a strong understanding of project management principles to ensure timely delivery of data solutions aligned with business objectives. Data Modeling: Lead the creation of conceptual and logical data models to support analytics initiatives and ensure dataintegrity. Data Products and Standardization: Drive the creation and implementation of data products in alignment with the organizationâ€™s data strategy. Promote standardization and best practices to ensure alignment with organizational goals. Change Management: Act as a catalyst for change within the organization, promoting and embedding a culture of data-driven decision-making. Facilitate the transition to standardized, strategic approaches to data and analytics. Serve as an advocate for data governance and quality assurance practices. Data Requirements: Collaborate with business users to define data requirements and translate unstructured business problems into structured data designs and solutions. Data Wrangling: Conduct ad hoc sourcing, extraction, profiling, and integration of data to support omnichannel campaigns, advanced analytics, and Data Science model generation. CRM and ERP Data Models: Apply knowledge of CRM and ERP data models to ensure solutions align with organizational data structures and processes, facilitating seamless integration and analysis. Analytics Problem Solving: Coordinate the translation of business problems into analytics questions, propose solutions,and deliver actionable insights. Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders, ensuring clear communication of results, uncertainties, and limitations. Advanced Analytics: Provide expertise in exploratory, descriptive, and predictive data analytics as a first level to shape solutions that drive business value in collaboration with data scientist. Visualization Development: Create innovative visualizations and tools to support complex analytical solutions. Innovation and Trends: Stay updated on trends, methodologies, and developments in analytics to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Global and Local Data & Reporting Ecosystems: Liaise with global digital and data and reporting teams on projects related to global data ecosystems and act as a bridge between global and local teams. Adoption and Training: Drive adoption of available tools with stakeholders and provide training to collaborators on optimal use of key data and analytics tools. Regulatory and Data Governance Compliance: Develop, implement, and maintain tools and solutions that meet regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, industry-specific directives). titulo_oferta: Oliver Wyman Digital: Data & Analytics - Analyst/ Senior Analyst - Madrid (Spain)
descripcion: WHO WE ARE:Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.We are looking for Analysts and Senior Analysts to pursue a career in quantitative analytics. Working with us offers excellent career and growth opportunities for highly motivated individuals with relevant education in a quantitative subject.WHAT YOU WILL DO:As a member of Oliver Wymanâ€™s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges.Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas.Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.Notable projects include:Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles â€“ click here for more informationModelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banksOptimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkitValidating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bankDeveloping probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banksIdentifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology â€“ click here for more informationDeveloping a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom companyWHY JOIN USExpect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, youâ€™ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.You wonâ€™t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. Youâ€™ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If youâ€™re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!Immediate impact, continuous challengeâ€¯ You'll work on challenging projects that have a significant impact on clients, industries, and societies from day one.Weâ€™ll ask you to be brave, challenging the status quo and constantly striving to build something new to shape our firm and the world around us. Youâ€™llâ€¯be a contributing team member from the start, building trust-based relationships with stakeholders and delivering breakthroughâ€¯impact.â€¯ Your learning curve will be steep, with each project offering new opportunities to expand your toolkit and to team with specialists who have deep subject-matter and technicalâ€¯expertise. Youâ€™ll likelyâ€¯have the chance to travel within your home market and internationally. No two weeks are ever the same.â€¯ Click here to learn even more.Chart your course; we support the journeyâ€¯Youâ€™llâ€¯have the opportunity to work on projects across all our industries and capabilities and will be able to specialize early or leave it until several years in.â€¯ Various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career, including a dedicatedâ€¯buddy, a careerâ€¯adviser,â€¯and your talent manager.â€¯ We care deeply about sustainable work-life quality and provide for career flexibility with a variety of programs including sabbaticals, non-profitâ€¯fellowships, and externships.â€¯ We hire you to be youOur open, inclusive, and down-to-earth culture will enable you to bring your best authentic self to work. Youâ€™ll work alongside down-to-earth colleagues who do serious work, but donâ€™t take themselves too seriously. Thereâ€™s no corporate mold to fit and hierarchy doesnâ€™t get in the way. gaps and create action plans to address and roll out solutionsTechnical Collaboration:Work with the tech team to drive their solutions and maintain continual feedback loops.Serve as the point of contact for source data teams.Business Analyst:Business-Technology Liaison:Act as the liaison between business and tech teams, assessing data sources, guiding the dev team on where to find data, and ensuring proper formatting.Conduct deep dives into data sources to model into IPM (IQVIA Performance Management) data sets.Agile Practices:Attend daily stand-up calls with the development team to gain status updates and address team queries.Ensure JIRA is up to date, perform testing, UAT, and groom user stories.User Support and Training:Provide one-on-one assistance to users, helping them with specific functions such as filtering data and extracting to Excel.Assist users with data queries.Lead generic training sessions for users.Qualifications:Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, project management, or a related role, preferably in the healthcare or life sciences industry.Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, PowerBI) and familiarity with database management systems.Strong understanding of business process modeling, requirements gathering, and project management methodologies.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with finance function and analytics.Knowledge of regulatory requirements and standards in the healthcare industry.Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA) or Project Management (e.g., PMP) is a plus.What We Offer:A dynamic and innovative work environment.Opportunities for professional growth and development.Competitive salary and benefits package.The chance to make a significant impact on healthcare and We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Join us in driving healthcare forward and make a difference with IQVIA!IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. Are you interested in joining a dynamic and international team of professionals to transform education? IE Universitys IT Department is looking for a AI Engineer to join its team!â€¯The Artificial Intelligence Engineer, preferably with a PhD and a strong track record in the development and implementation of advanced AI solutions. The ideal candidate will lead innovative projects, collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, and apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to solve complex challenges in various academic and research sectors. Proven experience in applying Large Language Models (LLM) and developing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques is absolutely mandatory, as well as advanced project management skills. Expertise in developing and deploying projects using LangChain or Directus for LLMs and RAG techniques is also required.Why IE University?With 50 years of experience and founded by and for entrepreneurs, IE University has turned business education on its head through disruptive teaching. We count on high-level faculty who bring real-world experience into the classroom and foster a hands-on approach to learning.Our PurposeAt IE University, we foster positive change through education, research, and innovation.As a transformative educational institution, we empower students to make their mark on the world. We provide them with the skills, knowledge and environment needed to make a difference, and they join a supportive and international community that lasts a lifetime.Our spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship has allowed us to drive change and constantly stay at the cutting edge of higher education. And through diversity, we have harnessed the power of people while also understanding and embracing the importance of humanities.Our PeopleAt IE we arePeople-drivenChange BuildersAutonomy EnthusiastsCommunication EnthusiastsKnowledge ChampionsWe are looking for a person to join a full-time position in Madrid. Your role as AI Engineer will involve Development of Advanced AI Modelsâ€¯Design, train, and optimize deep learning models, including Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), LSTM, Transformers, and GANs, applied to areas such as computer vision, natural language processing, and recommendation systems. Implementation of LLM and RAG Techniquesâ€¯Develop and integrate Large Language Models and apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation techniques to enhance the accuracy and relevance of AI solutions in academic and research projects. AI Project Managementâ€¯Lead AI projects from conception to implementation, coordinating multidisciplinary teams, managing resources, and ensuring objectives and deadlines are met. Integration of AI Solutionsâ€¯Collaborate with engineering and academic teams to implement AI solutions into existing systems and services, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and alignment with institutional goals. Research and Developmentâ€¯Stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in artificial intelligence, proposing and developing new techniques and tools that add value to the university and its research projects. Optimization and Scalabilityâ€¯Adjust hyperparameters, refine neural network architectures, and optimize data pipelines, ensuring efficient use of computational resources (GPUs/TPUs) and leveraging cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP) for horizontal and vertical scalability. To thrive in this role, you should have Educational Backgroundâ€¯PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related fields. Professional Experienceâ€¯Over 4 years of demonstrable experience in developing and implementing AI and deep learning solutions, with a strong track record in Deep Learning projects. Technical Skills Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R. Experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras. Knowledge of MLOps, best deployment practices, and pipeline management tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow). Experience handling big data and distributed ecosystem tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop) and knowledge of NoSQL databases. Specialization in LLM and RAGâ€¯Proven experience in developing and applying Large Language Models and Retrieval-Augmented Generation techniques, including the use of LangChain or Directus. Project Managementâ€¯Advanced skills in planning, executing, and overseeing AI projects, including team coordination and resource management. Cloud Infrastructureâ€¯Experience working with cloud infrastructures (AWS, Azure, GCP) and utilizing GPU/TPU environments for training and optimization. Languagesâ€¯Advanced English proficiency (C2 level), both written and spoken. Preferred QualificationsSpecialized AI Areasâ€¯Experience with advanced techniques in natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, recommendation systems, and/or reinforcement learning. Publications and Contributionsâ€¯Publications in recognized AI conferences or journals, and/or contributions to open-source projects or active participation in AI communities. DevOps and Containerizationâ€¯Knowledge of DevOps and containerization tools such as Docker and Kubernetes. Itâ€™s time to bring your best and make your mark.â€¯Now the choice is yours!If you want to be part of this educational revolution,â€¯we invite you to apply and be part of our amazing team at IE University.

About TemenosTemenos powers a world of banking that creates opportunities for billions of people and businesses everywhere. We have been doing this for over 30 years through the pioneering spirit of our Temenosians who are passionate about making banking better, together.We serve over 3000 clients from the largest to challengers and community banks in 150+ countries. We collaborate with clients to build new banking services and state-of-the-art customer experiences on our open banking platform, helping them operate more sustainably.At Temenos, we have an open-minded and inclusive culture, where everyone has the power to create their own destiny and make a positive contribution to the world of banking and society. THE ROLE The Manager â€“ Global Revenue Analytics role reports into Global Revenue Operations Lead. This role will lead a team of regional & global analysts to deliver operational analytics and reporting for the CRO organization. The revenue analytics team is expected to provide analytical & technical reporting capability, actionable insights & storytelling, leading indicator & predictive reporting, cross-functional collaboration & execution, and stakeholder communication. OPPORTUNITIES  Y ou will lead and establish a world-class team of analysts with a service-oriented leadership style.  You will be a collaborative member of the global revenue operations team and accountable for the CRO organization analytics & reporting function.  You will act as an individual contributor on strategic reporting with comfort delivering off-cycle reporting for CRO & Revenue Operations leadership.  You will establish reporting best practice and standards to ensure accurate, timely, and consistent reporting and measurement of sales metrics. Metrics include pipeline creation & management, sales activities, forecasting, coverage, and sales productivity & attainment, among others.  You will effectively communicate actionable and insightful information & recommendations to global & regional stakeholders and business partners (â€œtell a storyâ€ with the data).  You will utilize analytics & AI capabilities to identify leading indicators of risk or opportunity against sales & pipeline goals.  You will enable the revenue analytics team to support global & regional short-term, mid-term, and long-term revenue cadences by creating & maintaining dashboards and reporting tailored to all distinct revenue cadence moment.  You will develop a comprehensive understanding of the global business strategy and data structure, as well as connected people, processes, and systems, to be able to deliver ad-hoc reporting needs.  You will serve as a global expert of key performance indicator trends, actuals, and benchmarks through data analysis and conversing with business partners. Use this information to guide regional analyst direction & priorities, as well as encourage internal stakeholders to improve against benchmarks.  You will partner with team members of the data foundation, finance, FP&A, and IT teams.  You will serve both direct and indirect business partners with commitment, care, collaboration, and challenging the status-quo. Skills Y ou should have excellent leadership capabilities, with experience in building and developing high-performing teams through a defined leadership philosophy.  You should have clear communication and excellent interpersonal skills (both written and verbal) with a willingness to serve stakeholders and your direct reports.  You should have strong prioritization and project management skills leveraged to effectively manage limited resources within the team to focus on highest impact projects while meeting recurring objectives.  You should have strategic thinker with a track record of driving results against objectives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  You should have top-tier quantitative analytical skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and derive actionable insights.  You should have the ability to â€œtell a storyâ€ by communicating complex data insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, with demonstrated experience presenting & recommending to executive leadership.  You should have strong understanding of SaaS & Subscription business models and go-to-market strategies. Experience in the B2B software industry and reporting on software industry standard license and SaaS metrics.  You should have proficiency in Salesforce.com, Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint, and experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.  You should have experience with revenue intelligence & sales engagement platforms, such as Clari and Groove.  You should be comfort & familiarity with learning and leveraging AI capabilities in the revenue space.  You should have experience in a revenue operations or business analytics reporting or data analysis role.  You should have experience directly managing a team.  You should have a bachelorâ€™s degree in data science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field is preferred.  VALUES  Care about helping our clients succeed.  Commit to providing the highest level of support to your region.  Collaborate with peers and partners.  Challenge the status quo.  SOME OF OUR BENEFITS include:  Maternity leave: Transition back with 3 days per week in the first month and 4 days per week in the second month  Civil Partnership: 1 week of paid leave if you're getting married. This covers marriages and civil partnerships, including same sex/civil partnership  Family care: 4 weeks of paid family care leave  Recharge days: 4 days per year to use when you need to physically or mentally needed to recharge  Study leave: 2 weeks of paid leave each year for study or personal development Temenos is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please let us know.Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

titulo_oferta: Security Insight Data Engineer (Hybrid set up)
descripcion: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Engineer with a DevOps background to join our Security Insights Team., You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that supports data analysis and reporting activities. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with data scientists, analysts, and other team members to ensure smooth data operations, optimize data pipelines, and facilitate the delivery of useful insights.Join our team of cybersecurity professionals and help Swiss Re to fulfil its mission in making the world more resilient.About The TeamThe Security Team is the focal point for all security activities across Swiss Re. We are responsible for cybersecurity engineering and operations, governance, risk and compliance. We define, monitor and advance the company's security strategy. We are looking for a self-starter who is happy to challenge the status quo of existing processes â€“ aiming towards improving their efficiency and developing the solutions supporting them.As part of the Security Insights team, you will be responsible for enabling the Security team to make data driven decisions, by providing dashboards and insights.In your role, you willâ€¦ Build and manage robust data infrastructure, including data storage, processing, transformation, and visualization tools, using the Azure cloud-based platform and related technologies (such as Terraform)Implement and maintain CI/CD practices for data applications and infrastructure, automating deployment, testing, and monitoring processesCollaborate with data analysts, and business stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide technical support to enable seamless data access, transformation, and analysisOptimize data processing and ETL workflows, continuously monitoring and improving their performance, reliability, and scalabilityEnsure data security and quality standards are upheld throughout the data lifecycle, implementing appropriate data governance processes and best practicesYour QualificationsNobody is perfect and meets 100% of our requirements. If you, however, meet some of the criteria below and are curious about the world of cyber security and data insights, we'll be more than happy to meet you!What We Need From YouExperience with data engineering frameworks (e.g., Synapse, Databricks, Apache Spark, Hadoop).Experience with automation tools and technologies such as Terraform Experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL server, Oracle, SQL, MySQL) Proficiency in any programming language, examples include SQL, Python, PowerShell, C#, and RExperience with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Azure Dev-ops, Jenkins or GitLab Good communication skills in spoken and written English Nice-to-haveUnderstanding of technologies related to information security, vulnerability management, and Identity & Access Management Relevant work experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role Experience with other cloud platforms such as AWS and GCP Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies RoleFor Spain the base salary range for this position is between [EUR 41,000] and [EUR 69,000] per year (for a full-time role). The specific salary offered considers: the requirements, scope, complexity and responsibilities of the role, the applicantâ€™s own profile including education/qualifications, expertise, specialization, skills and experience.In the situation where you do not meet all the requirements or you significantly exceed these, the offered salary may be below or above the advertised range.In addition to your base salary, you may be eligible for additional rewards and benefits including an attractive performance-based bonus.About Swiss ReSwiss Re is one of the worldâ€™s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.KeywordsReference Code: 132476

This is a unique opportunity to use your software engineering and cryptography skills to build and maintain the security foundation that enables Ubuntu and its users to operate securely and remain compliant to international information security standards such as FIPS 140-3 and Common Criteria. You will use your applied cryptography, Linux Security, and coding skills to enhance the Ubuntu distribution and work with organizations such as DISA and CIS to draft and implement security hardening benchmarks for Ubuntu.As a member of the Security Hardening team you will work with and develop automation tooling to audit deployed systems for DISA-STIG and CIS benchmark compliance. You will interact with internal and external stakeholders to identify gaps in our frameworks, and develop new solutions to address these challenges. In this role you will have the opportunity to influence team and security culture, facilitate technical delivery, and help drive team direction and execution. You'll collaborate closely with Canonical's kernel team as well as the wider engineering organization to drive features impacting all Ubuntu users.Day-to-day responsibilitiesCollaborate with other engineers in the Security Hardening team to achieve and retain various Security certificationsExtend and enhance Linux cryptographic components (OpenSSL, Libgcrypt, GnuTLS, and others) with the titulo_oferta: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Core Team (ODS)
descripcion: Country: SpainData Analytics & Models AnalystOpen Digital Services is the software development company of Santander Group powering the next generation of banks by creating innovative banking products and implementing them in collaboration with Santander Group Affiliates.Santander Group is one of the world's largest financial institutions and the Eurozone's leader, we're committed to being the best Digital Bank with Branches in the industry.Our mission at ODS is to design and support an advanced digital and omnichannel platform, ensuring the best customer experience using cutting-edge technology. Openbank, our flagship partner, is where we develop our most advanced concepts first. Be part of our Best-in-Class team and help us create unique value for our customers!Join us to tackle exciting tech challenges in an agile environment, benefiting from learning, growth, and local and international career opportunities in a modern, diverse setting.Mission and responsibilities:This role provides the link between the pure commercial business needs with the analytical engines, creating the link between business areas and a team of data scientists. In particular, Data Science MLCore team is responsible for the ideation, development, maintenance and monitoring of machine learning models applied to business units (mainly Risk & Cybersecurity). It also develops methodological tools for the analysis and exploitation of information.Within the Data Science - MLCore team we go beyond optimizing the ROC-AUC curve; we expect you to have experience applying ML algorithms and engines to solve Business problems and take data-driven decisions.For this role you need to have at least 2 years of proven experience in an industrial environment.You think out of the box, you like to continuously think and propose new points of improvement for models. You love to learn and dig into rigorous analysis, but you are a problem solver that needs to understand the problem to solve. You enjoy never-faced challenges and data sources. You have interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies. You can explain complex topics to a diverse range of audiences. You feel comfortable with Scikit-learn, and sometimes you complement it with your own developments / functionalities. You feel comfortable participating in the development of scalable solutions and productizing; however, we have a ML-Operations team that will support you in achieving technical excellence. To be successful in the role you must have experience on:Software development:You know git and feel comfortable using it, and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. You are able to produce functional code beyond Jupyter Notebooks. Programming skills for data analytics. Knowledge of Python and Spark. Some experience in object-oriented programming is desirable. You know the basics of SQL and you are able to query essential information from multiple tables. Statistical modelling and machine learning:You have some experience with supervised and unsupervised problems. You have experience with binary classification problems, and you know standard ML methods. You know the difference between a random forest and k-means and know how to implement them. You know how to tune their hyperparameters in order to avoid overfitting/underfitting. You know different model evaluation metrics, and when one is preferred versus others. You have worked with problems from the beginning to the end of the process. What do we offer? Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.  Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.  Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.  Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.  Collaborating on international projects in different countries.  Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events. Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!ODS is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa BÃ¡rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.â€¯For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.OBTECH22

Department: AnalyticsLocation: SpainDescriptionTabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.The company's flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.What is the role?We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. The Product Analyst will work with our B2B Finance product team on the set of financial products for the B2B segment.Key ResponsibilitiesProvide analytical support to the B2B finance product and business teams across all aspects of their work, including evaluation of B2B loan funnel efficiency, revenue forecast modeling, and more.Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings in a clear and compelling manner that highlights the importance of your insights.Regularly work with several stakeholders, including product and marketing teams, on fundamental research as well as on one-time requests.Support and monitor existing B2B Finance metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.Develop data visualizations and reports that are both informative and easily understood by business and product teams.Assist in the planning of necessary data structures and data quality improvements.Skills, Knowledge & ExpertiseMinimum of 3 years of work experience as a data/product analyst.Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.Strong knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.)Experience in B2B analysis is a plus.A minimum of 1 year of experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a must.Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact with business and product teams. At least an upper-intermediate level of English proficiency is required.Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver. Strong motivation to develop your skills with a strong team.Job BenefitsRelocation and EmploymentWe offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, and UAE.What you can expectWe offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.Participation in the company's employee stock options program.Health InsuranceWe are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).If this sounds exciting to you, we'd love to hear from you!

The recent acquisition of DEIMOS by INDRA has significantly increased our demand for Flight Dynamics System services. Join us and become part of this exciting adventure. Experience a new era in the space sector, where traditional satellite operations are being transformed by mega-constellations comprising hundreds to thousands of satellites, frequent launches becoming the norm, and new multi-satellite mission concepts enabled by cutting-edge electrically propelled spacecraft. Moreover, the lunar industry is booming, with the number of planned lunar missions for the 2030s growing rapidly.This is why we are looking for a passionate Flight Dynamics Software Engineer to contribute to and lead our next generation of Flight Dynamics Services (FDS). If you dream of spending your days exploring the Moon but prefer stable ground, your place is here with us! We're expanding our Flight Dynamics team to tackle exciting ESA projects, and we want talented individuals like you to join our mission.What's the Challenge?You'll join our Mission Analysis Competence Centre, supporting the design of space missions from a mission engineering perspective for both ESA and commercial customers. Your main tasks will include supporting operations and software maintenance of ESA flight dynamics systems for trajectory analysis and optimization, and AOCS command generation.Your contributions will include:Development and maintenance of our in-house Flight Dynamics System (FDS).End-to-end development, validation, and use of high-fidelity FDS software for single satellite and constellation orbit propagation and manoeuvre simulation.Designing, optimizing, and automating orbit manoeuvre strategies and algorithms for constellation deployment, station-keeping, replenishment, collision avoidance, and re-entry.Developing Space Situation Awareness (SSA) and collision avoidance strategies.Preparing technical documentation related to the FDS.Supporting mission design for interplanetary and Earth Observation missions.Modelling and simulation of space systems, including space environment and space vehicle dynamics.Developing software tools to support mission analysis activities.Promoting technology research, innovation, and development actions.What Do We Need?We're looking for aerospace engineering graduates with postgraduate studies (e.g., M.Sc.) in aerospace engineering and between 0-5 years of experience in the relevant domains. To be successful in this role, you should have:High knowledge of celestial mechanics and astrodynamics.Trajectory optimization skills.Proficiency in programming languages: C++, Python.Experience with software engineering methods and techniques.Familiarity with orbital analysis software or tools.Additional Valued Skills:Experience in developing operational flight dynamics systems.Background in control, telemetry, or related fields.Knowledge of estimation theory and techniques.Experience with operations and familiarity with object-oriented programming.Educational Background:Postgraduate studies (e.g., M.Sc.) in aerospace engineering.Professional Experience:0-5 years in relevant domains.Language Skills:Excellent level of English, both spoken and written.Personal Attributes:High motivation and initiative.Autonomy in solving complex problems.Responsibility towards customers and team members.Willingness to work in collaborative groups.What Do We Offer?Flexible remote working model.Flexible start and finish times, with intensive working hours on Fridays.Personalized career development and training plans.Flexible compensation plan with the possibility of benefiting from private medical insurance, restaurant card, transport card and more.Wellbeing program: Individual training budget at your free disposal, team building activities, coffee, biscuits, fruit and more.Join Us!If you're ready to make a difference in the future of space exploration, send us your application and become part of our exciting adventure! ğŸŒŒğŸš€Ref.: HRRECRUIT-1038
